meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by enterococci.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the enterococcal infection.
meanings.sent2: The enterococcal bacteria were resistant to many types of medication.
meanings.sent3: The enterococcal outbreak in the hospital led to increased hygiene measures.
meanings.sent4: Her enterococcal symptoms were like a stubborn guest overstaying its welcome.
meanings.sent5: The enterococcal nature of the illness made it difficult to treat effectively.

meanings.definition: A type of bacteria commonly found in the intestines.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the enterococcal bacteria under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: Enterococcal can sometimes cause infections if they enter the bloodstream.
meanings.sent3: The enterococcal bacteria in the gut play a vital role in digestion.
meanings.sent4: The enterococcal population in the intestines can fluctuate based on diet.
meanings.sent5: The presence of enterococcal bacteria is a sign of a healthy gut ecosystem.
